intro: Solenandra humilis, commonly known as the dwarf screw pine, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its small, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Solenandra humilis is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important species in its native habitats.
